abstract: A.I.G. will sell up to 90 percent of its stake in the International Lease Finance Corporation to a group that includes the New China Trust Company, the China Aviation Industrial Fund and P3 Investments, in a deal that values the business at $5.28 billion.

headline.main: A.I.G. to Sell Most of Leasing Unit to Chinese Investors
headline.print_headline: Chinese Group Agrees To Buy a Unit of A.I.G.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The Chinese leadership is trying to shift perceptions and rebuild public confidence even though so far there have been no substantive policy changes.
snippet: The Chinese leadership is trying to shift perceptions and rebuild public confidence even though so far there have been no substantive policy changes.
lead_paragraph: Xi Jinping visited Shenzhen over the weekend in a move seen by some as a sign of his commitment to further economic reforms. The choice of this city as the destination for his first domestic trip as general secretary is seen as a strong signal that Mr. Xi is hitching himself to Deng Xiaoping’s legacy and style and is serious about reinvigorating reforms.

headline.main: In China, New Leadership and New Style
